entry.title: Blind Faith
entry.summary:
Author: AxisMage

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 61,166Chapters: 14/?Kudos: 77

Summary: It's no one's fault but his own that Dick is sitting there now, cold and utterly miserable, and very close to freezing to death.It's no one's fault but his own that he let his heart and mind get away again. It's no one's fault but his own that he wanted for someone who couldn't and wouldn't be his, and Wally is right.Dick needs to get back to his life, start over and make new friends. That's all, nothing more and nothing less. Friends, Dick needs friends, and sadly (according to Wally), Krypto isn't enough.

entry.title: You Are Out of My League
entry.summary:
Author: ivebeenbamboozled (brainwitchletty)

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 336,791Chapters: 35/?Kudos: 954

Summary: The story begins with a new Robin to replace the old, with Nightwing none the wiser to being replaced at all, and suddenly he has a little brother within the same terrible day. It takes a while to accept, but Dick quickly learns this new Robin-- Jason Todd-- is exactly what Dick Grayson was always missing in his life, and in many more ways than one. Through the years with the team and working with the Justice League, Jason finds a place for himself and becomes a vital member of the Young Justice League while also becoming a vital centerpiece in Dick's life. And when all that ends-- when Jason Todd is taken away from Dick-- it's going to be even harder to put his life back together with that emptiness returning once more.. . .Mostly canon compliant story detailing Jason's introduction to the Young Justice League as Robin, his eventual death, and Dick discovering the mysterious red-hooded figure acting as Ra's Al Ghul's bodyguard is a lot more familiar than he should be.

entry.title: Not Until You Say Goodbye
entry.summary:
Author: Mat_Vibes

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 63,394Chapters: 14/?Kudos: 24

Summary: What if the end of the world wasn’t just about destruction—but about love rewriting fate?In this story, Tim Drake is pulled into NERV, an organization that controls powerful mechs to fight off monstrous beings known as Angels. But saving the world is only half the battle—he also has to deal with all sorts of problems, especially his love-struck brothers and his own complicated feelings.As Tim faces powerful enemies to protect humanity, love, trust, and heartbreak start to shift the story from a tale of survival to something more—something deeper. Because in a world where everything seems predetermined, can the love between two people be enough to change destiny itself?If you’re looking for an epic mix of high-stakes action, deep emotions, and a love story powerful enough to defy fate—this is for you.

entry.title: Lightning in his Eyes and Thunder in his Wings
entry.summary:
Author: ToriaFiction

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 27,998Chapters: 11/20Kudos: 831

Summary: It's only a few months after Bruce takes Dick in that he discovers that he isn't human. A fact that Dick is entirely unaware of. Not knowing why the Graysons never told their son and not wanting to cause his new charge more pain, Bruce decides to keep the secret.Dick is seventeen when he discovers the truth. His and Bruce's relationship is already in shambles, and Batman doesn't let metas in Gotham. Dick doesn't want to lose a second home and family. So he doesn't tell anyone.Years pass, and life doesn't stop moving forward and changing. Dick flies in the high moments and crashes hard in the low ones.Then, just as Dick believes he has settled and gotten a handle on his life again, The Red Hood makes his appearance, and Dick’s life is flipped on its head once again.

entry.title: a grave in the sky (where it's roomy to lie)
entry.summary:
Author: svalas

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 35,519Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 100

Summary: Nightwing stood up, and the expression on his face made Spoiler step back nervously. His hand unfurled, shaking, revealing a sharp and bloody switchblade. Its body was a beautiful red. A phoenix had been carved into the side. “Somebody was here.” If his voice went any tighter it might shatter. “And we were too late.” (Again, he added in his mind.
